What benefits does Verus offer to users who want to create their own decentralized tokens or blockchains?

Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant, and can send and receive from the Verus chain.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha

How do PBaaS chains work in Verus, and what advantages do they offer?

PBaaS chains in Verus are decentralized, ID-issuing blockchains that can be created by any user. They are merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network, and all PBaaS chains run from the same daemon. This allows projects to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon and start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities.

What are DeFi liquidity pools in Verus, and how do they work?

DeFi liquidity pools in Verus are integrated into the consensus protocol and allow ID owners to define fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing issues like miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers.

How do simultaneous blockchain and liquidity pool launches work in Verus?

In Verus, a world-class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain can be launched simultaneously with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain.
